definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To connect or assemble pieces using a bolt.
examples: Bolt the vice to the bench.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , figurative ) To affix in a crude or unnatural manner.
( transitive ) To secure a door by locking or barring it.
( intransitive ) To flee , to depart , to accelerate away suddenly.
examples: Seeing the snake, the horse bolted .
The actor forgot his line and bolted from the stage.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To cause to start or spring forth; to dislodge (an animal being hunted).
To strike or fall suddenly like a bolt.
( intransitive , botany , of lettuce, spinach, garlic, onion, etc ) To produce flower stalks and flowers or seeds quickly or prematurely ; to form a bolt ( stalk or scape ); to go to seed .
examples: Lettuce and spinach will bolt as the weather warms up.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To swallow food without chewing it.
( transitive ) To drink one's drink very quickly; to down a drink.
examples: Come on, everyone, bolt your drinks; I want to go to the next pub!

definitions.definition: ( US , politics ) To refuse to support a nomination made by a party or caucus with which one has been connected ; to break away from a party.
To utter precipitately ; to blurt or throw out .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To connect or assemble pieces using a bolt.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , figurative ) To affix in a crude or unnatural manner.
( transitive ) To secure a door by locking or barring it.
( intransitive ) To flee , to depart , to accelerate away suddenly.
( transitive ) To cause to start or spring forth; to dislodge (an animal being hunted).
To strike or fall suddenly like a bolt.
( intransitive , botany , of lettuce, spinach, garlic, onion, etc ) To produce flower stalks and flowers or seeds quickly or prematurely ; to form a bolt ( stalk or scape ); to go to seed .
( transitive ) To swallow food without chewing it.
( transitive ) To drink one's drink very quickly; to down a drink.
( US , politics ) To refuse to support a nomination made by a party or caucus with which one has been connected ; to break away from a party.
To utter precipitately ; to blurt or throw out .

definitions.definition: To sift , especially through a cloth.
To sift the bran and germ from wheat flour .
examples: Graham flour is unbolted flour; in contrast, some other flours have been bolted .

definitions.definition: To separate , assort , refine , or purify by other means.
To discuss or argue privately , and for practice, as cases at law.
